attributes.action: provide financial incentives for supermarkets to provide paper bags for produce, rather than plastic ones.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
better for the environment, paper bags are reusable and less likely to end up in our landfull. 
they are safer for children ( ever handed a child a plastic bag full of grapes?) and wildlife as they biodegrade.
paper bags can compost giving back to the environment, plastic bags dont.
writing the date of your produce on a paper bag is a lot easier than on a plastic one. 

the resons why we dont use paper bags...
we dont like the soggy fruit falling out of the bottom of the bag - tell me why would you buy soggy fruit that wet anyway?

the supermarket dont provide them...

if grocers and market sellers recognise this valuable resource why cant the supermarkets - because they simply cost too much.

please subsidise paper bags for supermarkets and make them the cheaper option - or at least a viable alternative.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
